ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَٰتِ ذَرۡوٗا
TRANSLATION: (1) By the [winds] scattering [dust], dispersing [it]

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱلۡحَٰمِلَٰتِ وِقۡرٗا
TRANSLATION: (2) And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱلۡجَٰرِيَٰتِ يُسۡرٗا
TRANSLATION: (3) And the ships sailing with ease

ARABIC_TEXT: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَٰتِ أَمۡرًا
TRANSLATION: (4) And the [angels] apportioning [each] matter,

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٞ
TRANSLATION: (5) Indeed, what you are promised is true.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
TRANSLATION: (6) And indeed, the recompense is to occur.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ
TRANSLATION: (7) By the heaven containing pathways,[1535]
FOOTNOTES: [1535]- Explained as tracks, layers or orbits.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِي قَوۡلٖ مُّخۡتَلِفٖ
TRANSLATION: (8) Indeed, you are in differing speech.[1536]
FOOTNOTES: [1536]- About Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) and the Qur’ān.

ARABIC_TEXT: يُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ
TRANSLATION: (9) Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is he who is deluded.

ARABIC_TEXT: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّٰصُونَ
TRANSLATION: (10) Destroyed are the misinformers[1537]

ARABIC_TEXT: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ سَاهُونَ
TRANSLATION: (11) Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

ARABIC_TEXT: يَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ
TRANSLATION: (12) They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

ARABIC_TEXT: يَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفۡتَنُونَ
TRANSLATION: (13) [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

ARABIC_TEXT: ذُوقُواْ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ
TRANSLATION: (14) [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ
TRANSLATION: (15) Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

ARABIC_TEXT: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ
TRANSLATION: (16) Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

ARABIC_TEXT: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ
TRANSLATION: (17) They used to sleep but little of the night,[1538]
FOOTNOTES: [1538]- i.e., spending a portion of the night in prayer and supplication.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ
TRANSLATION: (18) And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
TRANSLATION: (19) And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ
TRANSLATION: (20) And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
TRANSLATION: (21) And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
TRANSLATION: (22) And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ
TRANSLATION: (23) Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

ARABIC_TEXT: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ
TRANSLATION: (24) Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?[1539] -
FOOTNOTES: [1539]- Who were angels given honored positions by Allāh.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ
TRANSLATION: (25) When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace; [you are] a people unknown."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ
TRANSLATION: (26) Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
TRANSLATION: (27) And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
TRANSLATION: (28) And he felt from them apprehension.[1540] They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ
TRANSLATION: (29) And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
TRANSLATION: (30) They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

ARABIC_TEXT: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
TRANSLATION: (31) [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

ARABIC_TEXT: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ
TRANSLATION: (32) They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals[1541]
FOOTNOTES: [1541]- i.e., those who defied Lot (upon him be peace).

ARABIC_TEXT: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ
TRANSLATION: (33) To send down upon them stones of clay,

ARABIC_TEXT: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
TRANSLATION: (34) Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
TRANSLATION: (35) So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities] of the believers.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
TRANSLATION: (36) And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.[1542]
FOOTNOTES: [1542]- i.e., Lot and his family, excepting his wife.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
TRANSLATION: (37) And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ
TRANSLATION: (38) And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.[1543]

ARABIC_TEXT: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ
TRANSLATION: (39) But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
TRANSLATION: (40) So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ
TRANSLATION: (41) And in ʿAad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.[1544]
FOOTNOTES: [1544]- Barren of any benefit, i.e., evil.

ARABIC_TEXT: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
TRANSLATION: (42) It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
TRANSLATION: (43) And in Thamūd, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."

ARABIC_TEXT: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
TRANSLATION: (44) But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ
TRANSLATION: (45) And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ
TRANSLATION: (46) And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
TRANSLATION: (47) And the heaven We constructed with strength,[1545] and indeed, We are [its] expander.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ
TRANSLATION: (48) And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ
TRANSLATION: (49) And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts]; perhaps you will remember.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
TRANSLATION: (50) So flee to Allāh.[1546] Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
FOOTNOTES: [1546]- i.e., turn to Allāh and take refuge in Him from disbelief and sin, thereby escaping His punishment.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
TRANSLATION: (51) And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

ARABIC_TEXT: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ
TRANSLATION: (52) Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

ARABIC_TEXT: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
TRANSLATION: (53) Did they suggest it to them?[1547] Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
FOOTNOTES: [1547]- i.e., Did the former disbelievers pass on these words to the Makkans so that they repeat the same expressions?

ARABIC_TEXT: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ
TRANSLATION: (54) So leave them, [O Muḥammad], for you are not to be blamed.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
TRANSLATION: (55) And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

ARABIC_TEXT: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ
TRANSLATION: (56) And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

ARABIC_TEXT: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ
TRANSLATION: (57) I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

ARABIC_TEXT: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ
TRANSLATION: (58) Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider,[1548] the firm possessor of strength.
FOOTNOTES: [1548]- Providing everything required by His creations during their decreed existence.  His provision includes guidance.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ
TRANSLATION: (59) And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors], so let them not impatiently urge Me.

ARABIC_TEXT: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
TRANSLATION: (60) And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
